description:
'''Dance-rock''' is a [[Dance music|dance]]-[[Fusion genre|infused]] genre of [[rock music]]. It is a [[post-disco]] genre connected with [[pop rock]] and [[post-punk]] with fewer [[rhythm and blues]] influences. It originated in the early 1980s, following the decline in popularity of both [[punk rock|punk]] and disco.

Examples of early dance-rock include [[Gina X Performance|Gina X]]'s "No G.D.M.", [[Russ Ballard]]'s "On the Rebound", artists such as [[Arthur Russell (musician)|Dinosaur L]], [[Liquid Liquid]] and [[Polyrock]], and the compilation album ''[[Disco Not Disco]]''.
